author: Chandra Philip
description: Montreal police have arrested a suspect after an Israeli flag was set on fire outside of the municipal building of a town with a large Jewish population. The Montreal City Police Services (SPVM) said it received a call around 7 a.m. on Aug. 25 about a fire in front of the Hampstead Town Hall on […]
title: Montreal Police Say Suspect Arrested After Israeli Flag Burning Outside Town Hall

author: Noé Chartier
description: Energy Minister Tim Hodgson said there is much appetite for Canadian liquefied natural gas (LNG) in Germany and that it could be satisfied from the West Coast. The Liberal government has previously not been favourable to shipping LNG to Europe, and there is currently a lack of infrastructure giving access to the Atlantic Ocean. It […]
title: German Companies Ready to Buy Canadian LNG From West Coast: Energy Minister

author: Catherine Yang
description: More than 20 agencies signed onto a new cyber advisory urging companies and governments to actively hunt for the threat actors.
title: US, Allies Link Beijing-Backed Salt Typhoon Hacking Group to 2 More Chinese Companies

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: US–South Korean Military Exercise, Church Shooting, Flood In India

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Ottawa’s Strong Borders Act could infringe upon Canadians’ Charter rights, including equality rights and privacy implications, a report by the Library of Parliament suggests. The Strong Borders Act, also known as Bill C-2, aims to strengthen the country’s national security by providing law enforcement with “enhanced tools” to secure Canada’s borders. The report warns that […]
title: Government’s Strong Borders Act May Infringe on Charter Rights: Parliamentary Report

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec’s former minister of Cybersecurity and Digital Technology has told a public inquiry he knew the provincial auto insurance board’s digital transition project was over budget in 2021. Éric Caire made the comments while testifying before the Gallant Commission, which is investigating how the creation of the auto board’s online platform ended up more than […]
title: Ex-Minister Tells Quebec Auto Board Scandal Inquiry He Knew Project Was Over Budget

author: Chandra Philip
description: A Calgary police officer is facing multiple charges in connection with theft allegations from a number of local hardware stores. Calgary Police Service (CPS) said in an Aug. 26 release it received a complaint earlier this month relating to “fraudulent activity” and “multiple thefts” from hardware stores in Calgary and the surrounding areas. An investigation […]
title: Calgary Police Officer Charged With Fraud and Theft From Hardware Stores

author: Jack Phillips
description: The incident is the fourth time this month a Russian plane entered an Air Defense Identification Zone near Alaska.
title: US Scrambles F-16 Fighters to Intercept Another Russian Spy Plane Near Alaska

author: Emel Akan
description: The meeting follows the collapse of cease-fire talks and Israel’s launching military actions to seize Gaza City.
title: Trump to Host White House Meeting on Gaza’s Future

author: Noé Chartier
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre says his party will press for the removal of the Clean Fuel Regulations, which he referred to as the “carbon tax 2.0,” when Parliament returns this fall. “What did the last carbon tax add to your gas? Seventeen cents a litre,” Poilievre said during a media event in Prince Edward Island […]
title: ‘Carbon Tax 2.0’: Poilievre to Target Clean Fuel Regulations When Parliament Returns

author: Adam Morrow
description: According Moscow, Russian forces have already captured a number of settlements in the strategic Ukrainian region.
title: Mixed Reports of Russian Forces Holding Ground in Dnipropetrovsk

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Premier Danielle Smith is asking Albertans to provide input on how her government should implement nuclear power in the province to fulfill its future energy demands. Smith announced this week that a provincial panel has been appointed to interact with residents and give the public a chance to influence the province’s nuclear path. “Nuclear power […]
title: Alberta Invites Public Feedback on Developing Nuclear Power Sector

author: Epoch Video
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, French President Emmanuel Macron, Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk, and Moldovan President Maia Sandu deliver addresses to Moldovans marking Moldovan Independence Day before attending an Independence Day concert in Chisinau, Moldova. This event is scheduled to begin at around 12:45 p.m. ET on Aug. 27.
title: LIVE NOW: Macron, Merz, Tusk, and Sandu Deliver Speeches Marking Moldovan Independence Day

author: The Canadian Press
description: Natural Resources Minister Tim Hodgson says the federal government’s new major projects office will launch this week, a key element in the Ottawa’s push to spur companies into building new large-scale infrastructure. The Liberal government rushed its major projects bill through Parliament in June so it could speed up approval times for large industrial projects. […]
title: Hodgson: Major Projects Office to Launch This Week

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal privacy commissioner says individuals have the right to have some information delisted from search engine results, but Google is refusing to comply. In his decision in a long-running case that has been central to establishing the application of a “right to be forgotten” in Canada, privacy commissioner Philippe Dufresne recommended Google de-list articles […]
title: Google Refusing to Comply With ‘Right to Be Forgotten’ Delisting Decision

author: Chris Summers
description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said 'Russia’s aggressive posture' made it necessary to boost the German army, or Bundeswehr.
title: Germany’s Cabinet Approves Voluntary Military Service Plan to Boost Numbers

author: Chris Summers
description: Iran's deputy foreign minister for legal and international affairs, Kazem Gharibabadi, called for diplomacy to be given 'time and space.'

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Danish intelligence has warned that the Arctic territory is increasingly targeted by foreign campaigns seeking to exploit divisions.

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Health Canada is initiating a recall of more than 17,000 units of Lars brand dining furniture after detecting high levels of lead on the finishes of the tables and chairs sold at The Brick. The furniture, which was sold both individually as well as in sets of five or seven, were discovered to have lead […]
title: Dining Furniture Sold at The Brick Recalled Over High Lead Levels

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canada Post has reported a second-quarter loss of $407 million for 2025, marking the largest quarterly loss the struggling Crown corporation has announced to date. The before-tax loss was the result of a 37 percent drop in parcel revenue and volumes, Canada Post said an Aug. 26 statement, a situation it attributed to customer uncertainty as […]
title: Canada Post Announces Largest Single-Quarter Loss of $407M

author: Epoch Video
description: The annual “La Tomatina” food fight festival takes place in Bunol, Spain, on Aug. 27.
title: REPLAY: Annual ‘La Tomatina’ Festival Takes Place in Spain

author: The Canadian Press
description: Vancouver International Airport is reporting that some of its flights are being delayed, citing staffing shortfalls with NAV CANADA. A media release from the airport says that due to unexpected staffing constraints at the country’s air navigation service provider, passengers may experience changes to their flights. That includes delays that may affect connecting flights and […]
title: Vancouver International Airport Reports Delays, Cites Staffing Issues With NAV CANADA

author: The Canadian Press
description: As the latest change to the Canada-U.S. trade relationship is about to take effect, Melissa Caracas Le-Fort is facing a deadline of her own. After Caracas Le-Fort announced on social media mid-August that her business would no longer take orders from American customers after Aug. 26, requests for custom-made pet tags began pouring in. Now, […]
title: Small Businesses Brace for Higher Costs as US Ends Shipping-Fee Exemption

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada-U.S. Trade Minister Dominic LeBlanc met with U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick on Tuesday in Washington as Ottawa looks to find relief from President Donald Trump’s tariffs on key Canadian sectors. LeBlanc’s office described the meeting, which also included Canada’s Ambassador to the U.S. Kirsten Hillman, as lengthy and constructive. Carney’s Chief of Staff Marc-André […]
title: LeBlanc Has Lengthy and Constructive Meeting With Lutnick in Washington

author: Epoch Video
description: French President Emmanuel Macron, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, and Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk travel to Moldova to meet President Maia Sandu at the presidential palace in Chisinau to mark Moldovan Independence Day and later hold a joint press conference. The meeting is scheduled to begin at around 9 a.m. ET on Aug. 27.
title: LIVE NOW: French, German, Polish, and Moldovan Leaders Meet in Moldova to Mark Independence Day

description: The three ventures are expected to generate up to four gigawatts of renewable power—enough to supply around 2.7 million homes.

author: AAP
description: A fight to divide the spoils of a $90 million (US$58 million) fine could make former Qantas staffers $22,000 richer if the airline is not ordered to further fill union coffers. Qantas outsourced 1,820 baggage handling, cleaning, and ground staff roles during the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, a move the Federal Court ruled was designed […]
title: Workers, Union Line up for Share of $90 Million Qantas Fine

author: Cindy Li
description: 'It’s a culture of no, a culture that has effectively blocked new housing,' said NSW Premier Chris Minns.
title: Sydney Can’t Survive as a ‘Museum’: Premier Warns City Losing Its Young People

author: AAP
description: A girl has died while more than a dozen people have been hospitalised, two in critical condition, after a school bus tipped. The crash near Stonehaven, in Victoria’s south, about 8:20 a.m. on Wednesday, closed a highway west of Geelong. Victoria Police said a girl died at the scene and a boy was flown to […]

description: Westpac says economic growth is likely to be modest in Australia over the coming year, but New Zealand's will recover to more normal levels.

author: Chandra Philip
description: A majority of B.C. residents do not support electric vehicle (EV) mandates, according to a recent poll, despite the province being among the top for EV sales in 2024. The Ipsos poll commissioned by the Energy Futures Institute found 56 percent were not in favour of government EV mandates, while 34 percent said they supported […]
title: Support for EV Mandates Drops in BC: Survey

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The B.C. Conservatives are calling on the federal government to refer the implications of a recent court decision that granted land title rights to a First Nation group to the Supreme Court of Canada, saying the ruling has raised legal questions and created uncertainty about private property rights. B.C. Conservative Leader John Rustad said in […]
title: BC Conservatives Urge Ottawa to Refer Decision on First Nation Land Title Rights to Supreme Court

author: Meghan Lett
description: MARTENSVILLE, Sask.—Cam Merkle doesn’t quite know what compels him to carve. But he does know where it began—in the summer of 1982, when he walked into the Wascana Centre in Regina, Sask., and saw three carvings of birds. “As soon as I saw those carvings, some kind of a switch just flipped in me,” Merkle […]
title: From Obsession to Success: A Saskatchewan Man’s Journey of Bird Carving

description: Clark, who is a member of The Elders, visited the Rafah border crossing earlier this month, along with former Irish president Mary Robinson.
